pros:
Co-workers are supportive 
Work is not too hard
cons:
Pay is lower compared to other hospitals
Entitled families

pros: Calvary Hospital is a good place to work as a new Nursing Assistant. Working at Calvary I was able to build my skills and resume. This is non-profit organization with decent benefits. Calvary offers tuition reimbursement, health insurance through Emblem Health as well as a pension plan. I would recommend this employer to anyone who is new and gaining experience as a Nursing Assistant. No experience is needed and Calvary will hire new graduates.
cons: The workload may be heavy at times because of staffing shortages especially at the Brooklyn location. Be prepared to do post mortem care as this is a hospice setting. Also be prepared to deal with grieving families and frequent deaths. This job is not for the weak or faint at heart.

pros: We are good at what we do
cons: Culture is changing- the family atmosphere is gone

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Bronx, NY
pros: Competitve salary, yearly raises, alright benefits and uniform pay. Parking spaces for employees and a cafeteria. Definitely better pay than a nursing home.
cons: Short staffed as in everywhere. Should be 5 techs on every unit on dayshift daily. Salary can always be more for the work we do. You have staff that are not part of nursing putting in their input where it does not belong. Needs more team effort for techs and nurses.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bronx, NY
pros: Clean hospital, each unit has a secretary, home hospice agency has 5 more clerks as support to field staffs.
cons: If you don’t belong to the “click or has no connection” you get nowhere and at their mercy for vindictiveness. Only those with “special connection “ will never do anything wrong and can get away with murder. I left the place to be away from low vibration of those people. However, the clerks worked very hard in that office.

pros: It's a privilege to work with a long term, stable Board and Administration, serve a unique and wonderful Mission, and alongside the most compassionate staff in the world!
cons: I can't think of a reason to work anyplace else.

pros: Hours location proximity to transportation and access to other hospitals shifts were good after putting in some time on the job bosses were decent
cons: Traffic and breakdowns and waiting and delivering medicines. And sometimes paperwork and going to different locations sometimes differing with management on the best way of delivering items

review_title: A very compassionate hospital to both patients and families.

pros: Excellent hospice care for the needful.

pros: great working hours in morning shift

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Bronx, NY
pros: Great place to work at for hospice and palliative care
cons: Sometimes can be stressful due to loss if patient who are end of life

job_title: RN Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: Your fellow employees in the field will be very supportive.  The caseload is reasonable.  The work can be very rewarding, and you provide services for families at every strata of society.
cons: The training is minimal.  The electronic health records software is very clumsy and documentation requirements are quite onerous, more than should be the case.  There exists the typical disconnect between the office staff and the field teams that work at the bedside.  Commuting between clients within the borough of Manhattan can eat up half your day, especially during inclement weather.

pros: Calvary is a place that is very humble whether you work there or if you are a resident. The employees there are very helpful to work with. At Calvary there is always opportunities to grow as a person and an employee.
cons: The most difficult part about working at Calvary is knowing that this is a place where many people come and they may not leave.

pros: One of the absolute cleanest and greatest hospitals to work in.
cons: Not enough room for advancement as many people end up working here till retirement. Managment will often hire from outside with education rather than hire a person from within with experience and knowledge.

pros:
Great place with a great mission
Cares greatly about patients and families

cons:

As an institution, not in favor of change or growth
